text: Tony Hoar (10 February 1932 - 5 October 2019) was a British racing cyclist. He represented England in the road race at the 1954 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Vancouver, Canada. He finished in last place in the 1955 Tour de France. Hoar died on 5 October 2019 of cancer at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from cancer Category:British cyclists Category:Sportspeople from Hampshire
title: Tony Hoar
